Ray_Kennedy_(country_singer):
{{short description|American music artist}} {{Use mdy dates|date=September 2020}} {{Infobox musical artist| | image = | name = Ray Kennedy | background = solo_singer | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1954|5|13}} | origin = [[Buffalo, New York]], U.S. | instrument = Vocals, guitar | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | occupation = Singer-songwriter, record producer | years_active = 1990-present | label = [[Atlantic Records|Atlantic]] | website = {{url|raykennedyproducer.com}} }} '''Ray Kennedy''' (born May 13, 1954)Whitburn, Joel (1996). ''The Billboard Book of Top 40 Country Hits'', p.173. {{ISBN|0-8230-7632-6}}. is an American [[country music]] artist. He has recorded two albums for [[Atlantic Records]]. His two albums produced four singles that appeared on the [[Hot Country Songs]] charts; 1990's "[[What a Way to Go (song)|What a Way to Go]]" was his only top 40 country hit and peaked at No. 10. Born in [[Buffalo, New York]], Kennedy won a [[Grammy Award]] in 2005 in the [[Grammy Award for Best Contemporary Folk Album|Best Contemporary Folk Album]] category for producing [[Steve Earle]]'s album ''[[The Revolution Starts Now (album)|The Revolution Starts Now]]''. He has produced many recordings with Earle which are collectively known as The Twangtrust.{{cite web|last=Mixonline|title=Steve Earle interview/review|url=http://mixonline.com/recording/interviews/audio_steve_earle/|accessdate=August 10, 2013|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130530211337/http://mixonline.com/recording/interviews/audio_steve_earle/|archivedate=May 30, 2013}} His father, Ray Kennedy, Sr., was a [[credit manager]] for [[Sears]], and was a subsequent creator of the [[Discover Card]], which was launched in 1985. Ray Jr. is married to [[Siobhan Maher Kennedy]].{{cite web|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/liverpool-entertainment/echo-entertainment/2002/03/22/why-i-m-in-blues-heaven-again-100252-11726044/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121010203612/http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/liverpool-entertainment/echo-entertainment/2002/03/22/why-i-m-in-blues-heaven-again-100252-11726044/ |url-status=dead |archive-date=October 10, 2012 |title=Liverpool Echo – Entertainment – ECHO Entertainment News – Why I'm in blues heaven-again |date= |accessdate=April 10, 2020}} ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:12em;"| Title ! rowspan="2" style="width:18em;"| Album details !| Peak positions |- style="font-size:smaller;" ! style="width:60px;"| [[Top Country Albums|US Country]] |- ! scope="row"| ''[[What a Way to Go (Ray Kennedy album)|What a Way to Go]]'' | * Release date: July 17, 1990 * Label: [[Atlantic Records]] | 51 |- ! scope="row"| ''Guitar Man'' | * Release date: October 27, 1992 * Label: Atlantic Records | — |- | colspan="3" style="font-size:8pt"| "—" denotes releases that did not chart |} ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2" style="width:12em;"| Single ! colspan="2"| Peak chart
